title: Understanding Spontaneity
text: Consider the Gibbs free energy equation, ΔG $$=$$ ΔH - TΔS. If ΔG is negative, the process will occur spontaneously.

title: Calculating Gibbs Free Energy Change
text: Use the formula ΔG $$=$$ ΔH - TΔS to calculate the change in Gibbs free energy at $$350$$ K. Remember to convert units where necessary.

title: Unit Conversion
text: Since ΔH is given in $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$ and ΔS in J/K*mol., convert ΔS into kJ by dividing by $$1000$$ before calculating ΔG.

title: Calculating Gibbs Energy
text: Substitute ΔH and TΔS into the equation ΔG $$=$$ ΔH - TΔS.

title: Interpreting Gibbs Energy
text: If ΔG is positive, the process is non-spontaneous under the given conditions. If ΔG is negative, it is spontaneous.

title: Conclusion Based on Gibbs Free Energy
text: Based on the Gibbs free energy calculated, determine if vaporization at $$350$$ K is spontaneous.
